Description: To prohibit taxpayer funded abortions.
Name: No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

Description: To amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that major rules of the executive branch shall have no force or effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted into law.
Name: Regulations from the Executive in Need of Scrutiny Act of 2017
Status: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 115-21.

Description: To amend title 18, United States Code, to protect pain-capable unborn children, and for other purposes.
Name: Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

Description: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide a means by which nonresidents of a State whose residents may carry concealed firearms may also do so in the State.
Name: Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

Description: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the excise tax on medical devices.
Name: Protect Medical Innovation Act of 2018
Status: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 528.

Description: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify presumptions relating to the exposure of certain veterans who served in the vicinity of the Republic of Vietnam, and for other purposes.
Name: Blue Water Navy Vietnam Veterans Act of 2017
Status: Committee on Veterans' Affairs. Hearings held.

Description: To amend title 18, United States Code, to require that the Director of the Bureau of Prisons ensure that each chief executive officer of a Federal penal or correctional institution provides a secure storage area located outside of the secure perimeter of the Federal penal or correctional institution for firearms carried by certain employees of the Bureau of Prisons, and for other purposes.
Name: Lieutenant Osvaldo Albarati Correctional Officer Self-Protection Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

Description: To amend the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 to promote compliance through education, to clarify the requirements for demand letters, to provide for a notice and cure period before the commencement of a private civil action, and for other purposes.
Name: ADA Education and Reform Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate.

Description: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to improve and clarify certain disclosure requirements for restaurants and similar retail food establishments, and to amend the authority to bring proceedings under section 403A.
Name: Common Sense Nutrition Disclosure Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate.

Description: To repeal the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act providing for the Independent Payment Advisory Board.
Name: Protecting Seniors Access to Medicare Act
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

Description: To require the Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies to take risk profiles and business models of institutions into account when taking regulatory actions, and for other purposes.
Name: TAILOR Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

Description: To expand sanctions against Iran with respect to the ballistic missile program of Iran, and for other purposes.
Name: Iran Ballistic Missiles and International Sanctions Enforcement Act
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

Description: To amend the Truth in Lending Act to modify the definitions of a mortgage originator and a high-cost mortgage, to amend the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 to modify the definition of a loan originator, and for other purposes.
Name: Preserving Access to Manufactured Housing Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

Description: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for the protection of community centers with religious affiliation, and for other purposes.
Name: Protecting Religiously Affiliated Institutions Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

Description: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to clarify that section 230 of such Act does not prohibit the enforcement against providers and users of interactive computer services of Federal and State criminal and civil law relating to sexual exploitation of children or sex trafficking, and for other purposes.
Name: Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act of 2017
Status: Became Public Law No: 115-164.

Description: To amend the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 to monitor and combat anti-Semitism globally, and for other purposes.
Name: Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Anti-Semitism Act of 2018
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

Description: To amend the Uniform Code of Military Justice to prohibit the wrongful broadcast or distribution of intimate visual images.
Name: PRIVATE Act
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

Description: To amend the Public Health Service Act to eliminate the non-application of certain State waiver provisions to Members of Congress and congressional staff.
Name: To amend the Public Health Service Act to eliminate the non-application of certain State waiver provisions to Members of Congress and congressional staff.
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

Description: To require the Federal Communications Commission to study the feasibility of designating a simple, easy-to-remember dialing code to be used for a national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline system.
Name: National Suicide Hotline Improvement Act of 2018
Status: Became Public Law No: 115-233.

Description: To amend the Public Health Service Act to improve essential oral health care for low-income and other underserved individuals by breaking down barriers to care, and for other purposes.
Name: Action for Dental Health Act of 2018
Status: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Description: To amend the Controlled Substances Act to clarify how controlled substance analogues are to be regulated, and for other purposes.
Name: SITSA Act
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

Description: To help prevent acts of genocide and other atrocity crimes, which threaten national and international security, by enhancing United States Government capacities to prevent, mitigate, and respond to such crises.
Name: Elie Wiesel Genocide and Atrocities Prevention Act of 2018
Status: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 521.

Description: To amend the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982, and for other purposes.
Name: Nuclear Waste Policy Amendments Act of 2018
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

Description: To establish an Every Kid Outdoors program, and for other purposes.
Name: Every Kid Outdoors Act
Status: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

Description: To amend title 38, United States Code, to make certain improvements in the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.
Name: Harry W. Colmery Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2017
Status: Became Public Law No: 115-48.

Description: To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, and for other purposes.
Name: Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

Description: To clarify the treatment of two or more employers as joint employers under the National Labor Relations Act and the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938.
Name: Save Local Business Act
Status: Received in the Senate.

Description: To amend the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to improve the transparency of the Financial Stability Oversight Council, to improve the SIFI designation process, and for other purposes.
Name: Financial Stability Oversight Council Improvement Act of 2017
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

Description: To amend titles II, VIII, and XVI of the Social Security Act to improve and strengthen the representative payment program.
Name: Strengthening Protections for Social Security Beneficiaries Act of 2018
Status: Became Public Law No: 115-165.

Description: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit a health care practitioner from failing to exercise the proper degree of care in the case of a child who survives an abortion or attempted abortion.
Name: Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act
Status: Received in the Senate.

Description: To amend the immigration laws and the homeland security laws, and for other purposes.
Name: Securing America's Future Act of 2018
Status: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

Description: To reauthorize the grant program for school security in the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968.
Name: STOP School Violence Act of 2018
Status: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

Description: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1075 North Tustin Street in Orange, California, as the "Specialist Trevor A. Win'E Post Office".
Name: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1075 North Tustin Street in Orange, California, as the "Specialist Trevor A. Win'E Post Office".
Status: Presented to President.
